Kapil Sharma Gets Candid About His Failures, Admits That He Talks Nonsense & Needs To Mature
Kapil Sharma Gets Candid About His Failures, Admits That He Talks Nonsense & Needs To Mature
Kapil Sharma’s name would definitely go down in history. He tried his luck in the industry as a singer but became the most popular comedian instead. Venturing into the world of showbiz with a comedy talent hunt show, he swiftly climbed the ladder of success to having his own comedy show on Indian television.
Twitter
But then, the downfall began. Kapil Sharma has always been the centre of controversies since then. His alcohol problem, tiff with Sunil Grover and other comedians on his show and always coming late to shoot keeping the celebs waiting at times – Kapil Sharma went through a lot of trouble in the recent past, which reportedly includes going to the rehab as well.
Twitter
But Kapil Sharma says he has learnt a lot from his failures. “I talk straight from my heart. I am bit cautious now. There is a responsibility as a celebrity and I feel I need to mature and not talk nonsense (faltu)”.
Instagram
“You learn a lot from failure. I also learnt a lot during this phase and I would try not to repeat it again. I am thankful to those who stood by me.”
Twitter

He accepted the fact that he now shies away from the media and isn’t easily accessible to them. “I am afraid of something. Today negativity sells more. There is not much authenticity when it comes to publishing news. I am accessible to some and not to some.”
Kapil Sharma says he needs to stop talking nonsense, but isn't this nonsense that his fans mostly find funny?
